snippet: The Brecht Forum, which began in 1975 as the New York Marxist School, announced that it could not survive the economic climate and the real estate market.
abstract: Board of directors announces that realities of New York City's economy and real estate market have forced closing of the Brecht Forum, currently housed in Brooklyn, after 40 years; center, named for German playwright Bertolt Brecht, held classes, lectures and art exhibitions organized around the aim of examining the role of the political left in American society.
lead_paragraph: The Brecht Forum, which began in 1975 as the New York Marxist School, announced that it could not survive the economic climate and the real estate market.

headline.main: An Institution Exploring the Political Left Is Closing
